@thethingy, ignore post above apart from the thank you's. It was kaspersky interfering with it, nothing wrong with it at all. Seems to be a common problem with kaspesky users.
there is an advise about KIS. You must uncheck the option Block dangerous scripts (i could mistake i have russian GUI KIS)
@pozdnysheff. Thank you that worked, unblocking dangerous scripts in web anti virus. I found out later the 2011 version of kis has a fix so upgraded and no more problems.

Thanks it installs and runs with no problem. However, it seems it is the academic version since Expression Encoder says it comes with no codecs (look at help/about). I have searched a bit and it seems that because of licensing problems, the academic version if the "ultimate" studio does not have H.264 and some other codecs but the retail version does. Unfortunately it seems all other versions available here have the same problem.
AlefSin, codecs are add ons you get them free from ms

It is not the same thing. For example Windows 7 can playback H.264 files by default as it comes with the needed codecs but still Expression Encoder says it cannot create .mp4 files because codecs are missing. I suspect is it more than the windows codes and some components of the Expression Encoder are missing/inactive. Here is an answer a MS employee gave on a forum about this problem: "Thanks for your interest in Expression Encoder.  We have two version of Expression Encoder 4: The first is included in Expression Ultimate purchased through volume licensing, MSDN, and Bizspark, and does not include royalty-bearing codecs.  The second version is included in Expression Ultimate purchased through retail channels, and does include the codecs. The reason for needing two product versions is due to codec redistribution and reporting requirements."

AlefSin, you can still get the codecs though so it is the same thing, try k-lite, also install the sp;

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=17872a3a-4620-4b87-9d62-f29173d12625

Thanks, another great upload!

@thethingy: I do have a codec pack! I have the full K-Lite codec pack installed. I can make .mp4 with all other programs it is only Expression Encoder Pro 4 that cannot do it. It uses its own internal codecs. Check the about screen and no matter what codecs you have installed in the system, the Ultimate MSDNAA or the academic version says "without codecs". Again, as mentioned before Microsoft confirms that there are two Ultimate versions out there and only the retail version comes with all codecs.

To make it clear, here is what I have installed: Expression Studio 4 Ultimate (full install), Expression Studio SP1, latest K-lite codec pack. Problem: when you select .mp4 as the output format in the Encode optoins tab, you get a popup window saying: "this functionality is only available in the fully-featured Expression Encoder Pro". Reason? According to microsoft, only the retail version of the Ultimate has this functionality and on the other versions (academic, MSDNAA, etc.) it is disabled.
